meanings.definition: A person or machine that separates a mixture into its component parts.
meanings.sent1: The fractionator efficiently separated the different types of recyclables.
meanings.sent2: The factory invested in a new fractionator to improve their production process.
meanings.sent3: The fractionator at the recycling plant never missed a beat, always sorting everything perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a fractionator, breaking down complex problems into simple solutions.
meanings.sent5: The fractionator hummed softly as it sorted through the jumbled mess of items.

meanings.definition: A device used in the petroleum industry to separate crude oil into different components.
meanings.sent1: The fractionator efficiently separated the crude oil into its various components.
meanings.sent2: The refinery installed a new fractionator to enhance their oil processing capabilities.
meanings.sent3: The fractionator at the oil refinery was always busy, like a chef preparing a feast.
meanings.sent4: The fractionator acted like a magician, turning crude oil into valuable products.
meanings.sent5: The fractionator's job was crucial, ensuring each component was extracted accurately.
